intro: Cremanthodium pulchrum, commonly known as the showy cremanthodium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer, are typically pink or purple and attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
